title: 16-year-old girl accidentally shoots, kills friend, police say
content:
© 2017 Cox Media Group.
GWINNETT COUNTY, Ga. - A Gwinnett County teenager is in jail Thursday after police say she accidentally shot and killed a friend while playing with a gun.
Police say Lesley Salinas, 16, then tried to rush the victim to the hospital, leading police on a chase.
Dashcam video captured Lawrenceville police officers pulling over the car and then trying to save 19-year-old Dominic Smith’s life.
Officers performed CPR on Smith for eight minutes until paramedics arrived.
“An innocent kid is gone,” Smith’s uncle told Channel 2’s Tony Thomas.
Police say the shooting happened in a parking lot in a subdivision just outside of Lawrenceville. A group of teenagers were in the lot and the 16-year-old was handling the gun when it went off, according to officers.
“They had a gun, they played with it. In the strength of playing with it, he got shot,” Smith’s uncle said.
Investigators charged Salinas with involuntary manslaughter plus two other misdemeanors.
Smith's uncle hopes his nephew’s death will teach others.
“He was a good kid who's going to be missed,” he said. “Everybody should learn from this. Put down the guns.”
Gwinnett police say they are still trying to find the gun that was involved and figure out how many teens witnessed the shooting.
